H0.text: Natural selection is the evolutionary process that has adapted protonephridia to different tasks in different environments.

H1.text: Natural reproduction is the evolutionary process that has adapted protonephridia to different tasks in different environments.

H2.text: Natural variety is the evolutionary process that has adapted protonephridia to different tasks in different environments.

H3.text: Natural change is the evolutionary process that has adapted protonephridia to different tasks in different environments.

A4.text: Protonephridia likely first arose as a way to cope with a hypotonic environment by removing excess water from the organism (osmoregulation).

A5.text: In freshwater crustacea, the saccate metanephridia are especially large due to their role in osmoregulation; crustacea must remove large amounts of water from the tissues, as the cells are hypertonic to the surrounding water.
